ratio.title: refers to the split ratio. The split ratio is an inverse of the number of shares that a holder of the stock would have after the split divided by the number of shares that the holder had before. For example: Split ratio of .5 = 2 for 1 split.

tofactor.title: To factor of the split. Used to calculate the split ratio forfactor/tofactor = ratio (eg ½ = 0.5)

forfactor.title: For factor of the split. Used to calculate the split ratio forfactor/tofactor = ratio (eg ½ = 0.5)
